reviews.text: This is undoubtedly a beautiful place, the food is wonderful and the setting sublime. However, the service REALLY lets it down.
reviews.title: What a shame

reviews.text: There were a couple of members of staff who made it better for us, the lovely Irena and the new maitre D', but other than that the staff were rude.I can't imagine what Mr Ducasse would have to say about it all, I imagine he hasnt visited in a while.
reviews.title: Somewhere for a meal out?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a dark bed spread on our bed, which, when we arrived had a several unspeakably disgusting stains on it. We informed reception and were told it had been changed. It hadn't been and remained the same. One morning our room had not been cleaned, when i mentioned this to one of the staff she assured me it had been. It hadnt been, the bed remained unmade. I am not so much of a princess that i am unable to make my own bed, but at 780 euros per night (without breakfast) you may have thought that they would have done this.
reviews.title: Style over Substance
Sublime
reviews.text: On our last morning the manager of the hotel came to our room to inspect the bedspread and agreed it was disgusting. We also explained the other issues with the service. However, we were only given a small discount for our stay. This is a very expensive place to stay and the service certainly did not live up to expectations.

reviews.title: Wonderful place - needs new manager
reviews.text: Our family have lived in the area since the early 70s and seen many changes. Domaine Des Andeol is one of the more exceptional! We have eaten there a couple of times, just for special occasions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was recommended by a colleague who owns a property locally and I can't thank her enough for recommending it. This was the first time we'd stayed in the Luberon, but certainly won't be the last!
reviews.title: An amazing hotel in a beautiful part of France.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a cluster of houses converted into individual stylish appartments in a hamlet on a hill beneath St Saturnin-les-Apts set amongst lavender fields and rolling countryside. It is ultra-modern and minimalist in decor with the walls adorned with classy original modern art. We stayed in Maison l'Artist which was had a large living area with an adjacent dining area and a galley-style kitchen hidden behind doors...not that I had any intention of cooking a 3-course meal there! Upstairs was a master bedroom with a stylish bathroom within it. The bespoke concrete bath was functional but perhaps a little small for me!
reviews.title: Great with some small things to improve

likes.liked: — Location in this amazing area, the real Provence!!

reviews.text: The grounds were idyllic and the infinity pool was perfectly set with the lavender fields beyond as a backdrop. The only problem was it was freezing!
reviews.title: Nouvelle Provence?

reviews.text: The restaurant was elegant and the service impecable (as were all the staff in general). We stayed 3 nights and my only concern would be that the menu didn't change and one more night might have meant repeating some of the courses due to lack of choice.
reviews.title: Chic and Arty

reviews.text: Locally there are interesting villages and markets including Apt, Gordes, Avignon and Arles all within an hour's drive.
reviews.title: Oh My God....best place ever...but let's keep it a secret
